documents.title: Scope Proposal: External Engineering Augmentation for The Pets Table (TPT)
documents.content:
ÔªøScope

Scope Proposal: External Engineering Augmentation for The Pets Table (TPT)





Proposed Scope of Work & Deliverables

The augmented engineering team's scope of work will encompass the following approved initiatives. All deliverables are expected to be delivered for Web and Mobile Web, fully tested, integrated into our existing tech stack, and accompanied by necessary documentation.

New copy and assets should be editable through new contentful entries.

Priority

	High level designs 

(subject to adjustments)

	Initiative

	Customer problem & goal

	Requirements

	Is design ready for development?

	GridDynamics Briefed?

	1

	  



Multipet version (for users that have 2 or more dogs)  





	Checkout Confirmation Page 

[a]	

Post conversion, as a newly converted TPT user, I land on the ‚Äúdashboard‚Äù page. Users face multiple problems: 

* They are struggling to understand that they converted

* They are finding it hard to discover and interact with features that are available to them post-checkout. 





Goal: create a page that is shown after conversion, showing an order summary and a CTA to take on one of the recommended actions: Explore the  add-on store or add another pup (depending on the version. Ie: if a user mentioned they have multiple pets in checkout show the CTA to add another pup and if they didn‚Äôt, show addons store CTA)





(Expected Impact: Increase take rate of Add-ons and Increased Retention, Increase Multipet penetration)





	* 2 versions of the checkout page are created (multipet, addons)

* The order summary is shown as per the Checkout page 

* The user is shown the right version based on their pet profile data (number of pets) 

* This initiative is more than just this page UI. There's some logic involved on how this page is loaded, which differs from our current live state, as we want to remove the ‚Äúfrying pan‚Äù animation[b] - currently in prod (it gives the impression that the user needs to cook the food). The right flow is laid out on Figma.

	‚úÖ Yes.





Access Figma.





Access Prototype to see the animation in this flow.

	‚úÖ Yes (Jun 27, 2025)

	2

	Current component:  





Goal: 

  



	Dashboard improvements - Milestone 1: 

Quick Actions on Dashboard (Above Fold Repositioning)

	Active users are not aware of the options available to them to adjust their subscription, active users are struggling to navigate to features that they need to solve their problems. 





We want to replace the current quick actions with a scalable component for subscription management, where users will be able to find the features they need on the dashboard.





(Expected Impact: Increased user engagement with core functionalities, leading to mitigating the need of churning and improved retention, as well as reduction of empty reactivations)

	* Existing quick actions (currently placed on the bottom of the page) are redesigned to be placed above the fold as an accordion[c][d][e]

* Solution is scalable and can be extended by new features in the future[f][g][h]

* The header is formatted to the new design (UI changes only)

* View order total button on mobile is changed to an icon

* CTAs are reworked as per design - we show 2 CTAs below the meals change meals and feeding guide.





	‚úÖ Yes. Design is ready to be implemented.





Access Figma.

	‚úÖ Yes (Jun 27, 2025)

	3

	  



	Dashboard improvements - Milestone 2: Reduced Size of Meals on Dashboard

	While the weekly menu is static, the presentation of meals takes a significant amount of TRE. 





We want to optimize the display of meal information on the cust



 Fresh - 750, Dry - 750, Mixed - 750

   * 50% portions: Fresh - 500, Dry - 500, Mixed - 500

   * Important note: Not all calorie ranges will have a 50% or 75% option available, for smaller dogs this might not be available

   * < 89 calories

   * Between 89-149 - offer only 100% plan for dry and fresh 

   * This is handled by the NMPS API

   * Between 150-225 - offer 100% and 75% plan for dry and fresh

   * 226+ - offer mixed plan + 50% 75% and 100% percentages for dry and fresh

   * This has to be implemented in the FE because the API returns mixed plan for 50/75% portions





Switching the user‚Äôs portion percentage requires 2 API calls:

   * Patch the user‚Äôs subscription to update their plan - This is what‚Äôs actually responsible for changing the amount of food user‚Äôs get

   * Patch the pet profile to update the `portionPercentage` field - This field doesn‚Äôt have any direct impact on the user‚Äôs plan size, but it‚Äôs used to be able to identify these users as well as communicate to them what portion they‚Äôre feeding. 

   * This is necessary because the plan alone isn‚Äôt enough since the same plan could be a 100% portion for another dog (E.g. Fresh 500 calories could be a 50% portion for a big dog but 100% portion for a small dog)





Important components:

   * Portion % hook

   * Portion % badge

   * Quiz Steps

   * Quiz Allergens experiment setup - This is an old experiment that had the same setup as we want for this, we should repurpose this for the new experiment

[a]+ tracking

[b]This loading state is waiting for async updates in the background. There is an ongoing initiative to replace this for pre-checkout service but not ready yet

[c]@maria.chelminska@hellofresh.com I'm also noticing that there are changes to the CTAs under the header (Manage Delivery and Change Meals) are these included in this initiative?





Especially manage delivery because this functionality is covered by the Quick actions

_Assigned to maria.chelminska@hellofresh.com_

[d]Yes, you are correct, forgot to mention this

[e]added

[f]@maria.chelminska@hellofresh.com are we expecting anything specific here?

_Assigned to maria.chelminska@hellofresh.com_

[g]The component should be expandable - i.e. we can add more cards to the carousel. Should come out of the box, but I wanted to specify it.

[h]got it

[i]tracking

[j]tracking + analysis

[k]tracking

[l]+ pre / post

### EMAIL: Vodafone UK's marketing team just 2x'd content performance ‚Äî watch how
ID: 19b30ac53639eec3
From: Team WRITER <hello@engage.writer.com>
----------------------------------------

Campaign execution dropped from 14 days to 3. The framework is easier than you think.



CMO webinar hero (https://go.writer.com/e3t/Ctc/RL+113/d4QBTl04/VW_sSJ7RgcnmN3PF8PsJWQ1YW8QwHkG5HbYXYN56dXjb3prCCW8wLKSR6lZ3mhW6FLsxf9kc350W4SLzlf48tfNpN6S6Y0x2LYp_W2s_bHW1flq2CVnrvRb37c5nHW4gCN_545bN3kW1ysGcN8tFL9YW5lK5fv3Gffm_VxTNn82jP_GCW8NvYSJ77z-dkW67ylnG1Q9QtpW6FYr561MWB9dW5dPcWn7MTT_2W15wfd45Fgw3gW21f-8K6p5dH2W5xN1T11hH47PW5vW3xc6Br4xQN5p3j7VK2V-hW7x5Wwy3ldSnNN7WV4yqbyjmMW36fkRY9gBWMBW5_KrHQ6lS4m5W1VyxGp1BF7tXW8rd7ZC4c4f3XW26ZQZY5RtmH4W67DsPS2W7JbzW5nwMSZ4TDWHLW5PHJrQ64C_RbdDC6vx04 )



Hi Nikita,



Your customers aren't searching the way they used to.



VOIS and Vodafone UK are seeing this firsthand: AI-assisted searches jumped 9x in 12 months. Zero-click searches surged 13 points. When AI summaries appear in results, click-throughs drop 79%.



Translation: marketing playbooks need an update ‚Äî fast.



VOIS and Vodafone UK aren't debating AI strategy anymore. They're already seeing results (https://go.writer.com/e3t/Ctc/RL+113/d4QBTl04/VW_sSJ7RgcnmN3PF8PsJWQ1YW8QwHkG5HbYXYN56dXjb3prCCW8wLKSR6lZ3mhW6FLsxf9kc350W4SLzlf48tfNpN6S6Y0x2LYp_W2s_bHW1flq2CVnrvRb37c5nHW4gCN_545bN3kW1ysGcN8tFL9YW5lK5fv3Gffm_VxTNn82jP_GCW8NvYSJ77z-dkW67ylnG1Q9QtpW6FYr561MWB9dW5dPcWn7MTT_2W15wfd45Fgw3gW21f-8K6p5dH2W5xN1T11hH47PW5vW3xc6Br4xQN5p3j7VK2V-hW7x5Wwy3ldSnNN7WV4yqbyjmMW36fkRY9gBWMBW5_KrHQ6lS4m5W1VyxGp1BF7tXW8rd7ZC4c4f3XW26ZQZY5RtmH4W67DsPS2W7JbzW5nwMSZ4TDWHLW5PHJrQ64C_RbdDC6vx04 ) : campaign executi

### EMAIL: Reminder: HelloTech December All Hands Tomorrow!
ID: 19b2e985b96fc25b
From: Brian Leung <brian.leung@hellofresh.com>
----------------------------------------

Hi Team,



We‚Äôre looking forward to seeing everyone at tomorrow‚Äôs All Hands meeting! A

couple of quick reminders:



   - *Ask Me Anything*: Please submit questions via Slido

   <https://app.sli.do/event/r1bcuD7KtAVoX3cZRLEKUe>, which will remain

   open throughout the meeting. We have designed our agenda to reserve ~30

   minutes for questions, so please don't hesitate to submit topics on your

   mind.

   - *Office Watch Parties*: If you are in the office, please join your

   colleagues in these dedicated rooms. We hope to use these all hands

   meetings as a good excuse to meet one another, so keep an eye out for more

   in this space!

      - Berlin: Townhall

      - NYC: Good Chives Only (9th Floor)

      - Toronto: Lady Gaga Town Hall



See you there!



Best,

Brian



-- 



Brian Leung



Chief of Staff, HelloFresh



HelloFresh US | 28 Liberty St. | New York, NY | 10005



Phone: 609-731-2068 | Email: brian.leung@hellofresh.com

Notes from ‚ÄúTech Sync Good Chop‚Äù



These notes have been sent to invited guests in your organization.



Open meeting notes



The content was auto-generated on December 17, 2025, 9:18 PM CET and may  

contain errors.





Summary



Someone in Cobbler Hill (United States-NYCHQ, 7) identified an issue where  

a voucher remained applied after clearing attempts, causing the plan menu  

to disappear upon selecting a "one time box" option, and noted a  

configuration discrepancy where a necessary setting was missing on live but  

present on staging, which also caused the wrong menu to display. Someone in  

Cobbler Hill (United States-NYCHQ, 7) plans to prepare the necessary work  

to merge the required configuration setting into the live environment today  

and will ask someone from the town team to review the issue.

Hi Nirav,

Wanted to introduce you to Ian Brooks - our Canada CEO, who is looking to launch

a pilot program for Factor B2B in Canada. As far as I know Annatta was also

providing the services for Factor US B2B; so has the context in that space and

seemed like a natural fit to expand a paired down version to Canada.



Could you tell us when would be a good time to call?

To view this email as a web page, go to the following address: https://pages.usertesting.com/index.php/email/emailWebview?mkt_tok=MzcxLUZKWi04NTMAAAGezGRmlWr5SjxbEPbriQtt625_uL8lfCXMzXdom_1CzZc390BX_jRhADDh9yDN07jKxl0gzTE2gopbZJEOfnV2rMxJ1jWSyVLCwxkV1CDOm2qJ



The Exchange Notes



All about aesthetics: What makes  design¬†beautiful?



‚Äî----------------------------------------------------------



In this issue, we‚Äôre focusing on form over function with our best tips, tricks, and theories on designing for beauty.



But before we dive in...a quick shoutout to the 191 readers who clicked on the hidden Easter Egg in our last Exchange Notes.





Keep your eyes peeled, we‚Äôll be sprinkling more surprise-and-delight moments throughout future issues. You never know what you might find.



‚Äî----------------------------------------------------------



Featured case study



Wells Fargo Designs for Visual ‚ÄúApp‚Äùeal 



With more than 30 million customers, Wells Fargo bank has to manage a mind-boggling number of financial transactions happening every day on its mobile app. That means an app that doesn‚Äôt just get the job done, it‚Äôs got to look and make people feel great every time they use it.



Based on hundreds of tests conducted with UserTesting, the Wells Fargo team was able to create a Visual Appeal Index. This allowed them to rank exactly what type of visual elements were going to perform the best in the app, at any given time.



Love this index, but still shocked to see that p

### EMAIL: Notes: ‚Äú[Please Prio] Charge@Checkout OWL: Refund & Cancellation FLow‚Äù Dec 17, 2025
ID: 19b2d475ddbe76db
From: Gemini <gemini-notes@google.com>
----------------------------------------

Notes from ‚Äú[Please Prio] Charge@Checkout OWL: Refund & Cancellation FLow‚Äù



These notes have been sent to invited guests in your organization.



Open meeting notes



The content was auto-generated on December 17, 2025, 6:05 PM CET and may  

contain errors.





Summary



The team, including Shishir Mishra and Michael Lucero, discussed the target  

process for pre-cut off order cancellations and refunds via the AL system,  

with Shishir Mishra confirming the ideal process is to mark the order  

as "not shipped" and cancel the payment, a process known to agents.  

Gangadharan Khoteeswarun (Ganga) identified a bug in the payments domain,  

affecting automatic refund reconciliation for CNC orders and partially paid  

orders using process out, which means refunds only occur after the cut off,  

and stated that a fix is being tested for deployment to production soon.  

Participants including someone in Lower Feast Side (United States-NYCHQ,  

7), Shishir Mishra, and Hagag discussed agent processes, clarifying that  

cancellations do not happen via ART, and also addressed the confusion  

surrounding payment status and refund visibility for CNC orders before and  

after cutoff.





Suggested next steps





Someone in Lower Feast Side (United States-NYCHQ, 7) will try another one  

and follow the same steps to see that the identifiers are clear once the  

bug fix is pushed.





Meeting records Document Notes by Gemini

Notes from ‚ÄúHF CA B2B‚Äù



These notes have been sent to invited guests in your organization.



Open meeting notes



The content was auto-generated on December 17, 2025, 5:01 PM CET and may  

contain errors.





Summary



Ian Brooks initiated a discussion about launching a Shopify store in Canada  

to block out competition, with planned resources for March from Ian Brooks  

and Kevin to handle sales. Nikita Gorshkov detailed resource constraints  

due to the GC Netherlands migration blocking the implementation team until  

February, making a "lift and shift" of the US B2B Shopify store setup using  

Anata the most straightforward approach. Ian Brooks confirmed that a  

minimal integration pilot, focusing on a simple storefront and data output  

without SCM integrations for small volumes, would be sufficient to proceed,  

and Nikita Gorshkov noted that existing contracts with the US entity for  

factor, covering Shopify and Anata, would likely allow the Canadian  

business to piggyback on them.





Suggested next steps





Nikita Gorshkov will check in with Samir regarding the Shopify store setup  

and get back to Ian Brooks by Friday.



Nikita Gorshkov will talk with Ally today so she can start digging into the  

details.



Nikita Gorshkov will introduce Ian Brooks to Nurev to get a price quote  

from the agency for the needed work.



Nikita Gorshkov will ping Anata to check the cost of their services.
